question: 丈
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. This word is usually used for clothing <vocabulary>height</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>length</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is different from what you learned with the kanji. Remember the word <ja>竹</ja>? It has the same reading as this. Just think of everyone measuring the heights of things with <reading>bamboo</reading> (<ja>たけ</ja>) poles with markers on them. Okay, this one is 5 bamboo poles high!
